title: What should I do in Review?
content:
Review the generated matrix on the website, or download the matrix and work offline.

Because the number of taxa and characters can be potentially large, your web-browser may not be able to handle them at once. You can review a large matrix in smaller sections:
1. Select and load a subset of the taxa and characters, using the Preview and Selection Interface.
2. Review and edit selected characters in the Spreadsheet Interface.

You can define a set of colors to aid your review process and leave comments on any of the values.

title: Select taxa/characters in the Preview and Selection Interface
content:
The Preview and Selection Interface displays a list of taxa in the left side of the screen and a list of characters on the right. Characters are organized by the organs/parts they describe.

To select a set of taxa and characters for review, Click (or shift-click, for multiple selection) on taxa and on characters, then click on the Load at the bottom of the screen. You need to select at least one taxon and one character to load.

Right-click on a taxon, character, value to bring up their popup menus with additional functions.

title: Review a matrix in Spreadsheet Interface
content:
The Spreadsheet Interface displays a taxon-by-character matrix in a spreadsheet format in your browser. Each cell in the spreadsheet is associated with a menu, invokable by mouse-over the right-end of the cell and click on the downward-pointing triangle that appears. The menu in the (0,0) location affects the entire matrix and the menus elsewhere affects the specific character, taxon, or value.

Functions supported by the menus:
add, delete, modify, sort, lock taxa/characters,
comment on characters/taxa/values,
color characters/taxa/values,
show taxa as a hierarchy or as a simple list,
merge two characters,
split a character,
set valid values for a character,
perform basic analysis of a character,
show the original description for a taxon, etc.

Click in a value cell to edit the value.


Remember to save your work from time to time.

title: Configure and use colors
content:
Users can define a set of colors and use them to indicate the various status of the data in a matrix, for example, 'checked', 'to do', 'questionable'. Color settings, once defined, can be used in both Preview and Selection Interface and Spreadsheet Interface. Taxa/characters that have been colorized in one interface will be shown with the same color in the other.

To define color usages: Annotation > Color Settings . In Configure Color Usages, select a color, click on Add button. Then in Available color usages area, type in the usage for the color (e.g. 'checked').

After the Color Settings is defined, 'colorize' function will become available as a menu item for all taxa, characters, and character values.

title: Switch between the two interfaces
content:
If you are in the Spreadsheet Interface: go to menu bar, Matrix > Go to Preview and Selection Interface.

If you are in the Preview and Selection Interface, you need to select a set of taxa and characters, then click on the Load button (lower part of the screen) to go to the other interface.

title: Save/Output you work
content:
Click on the Save Progress button above the Spreadsheet Interfaces to save your work. All saved work will be kept in the final matrix output, which is one matrix containing all taxa/characters that have not been removed/deleted.

When you come back to the matrix (may be via the Resume or Rewind function in the Task Manager), you can resume your work from where you left the last time.

Remember to save your work from time to time.

To output the matrix, click on the Next Step in Matrix Generation button to leave matrix review step and process to the Output step in Matrix Generation.

You can also download a matrix to your local computer.

title: Download the full matrix
content:
Go to menu bar, Matrix > Download Matrix (with all taxa and characters) as a .csv file. The matrix includes all taxa and characters that have not been removed/deleted. Your browser must allow popup windows for this function to work.

The csv fill will only contain taxa and characters as text strings. Colors and comments are not saved in the csv file.
